posts.excerpt: First film by French cult director Jacques Rozier 20 minutes In a small village of Provence, on the first day at school, a young boy throws away his bag into the river because of a bet…

posts._title: Garin Nugroho – Puisi tak terkuburkan AKA Unconcealed Poetry (2000)
posts.title: Puisi tak terkuburkan
posts.excerpt: Timely in terms of current Indonesian politics but in other respects long overdue, Nugroho’s extraordinary film looks back to 1965, when the assassination of seven army officers was unconvincingly pinned on communists—giving the dictator Suharto all the excuse he needed for decades of authoritarian rule and arbitrary arrests. There were mass arrests and executions in …

posts.title: Baara
posts.excerpt: Synopsis In this early work, Cissé focuses on a young innocent who has left the countryside for the city and become caught in the middle of social conflict. Befriended by the manager of a textile factory, he watches as his mentor is caught between the demands of a cruel owner and the needs of the …

posts._title: Mike De Leon – Alpha Kappa Omega Batch ’81 (1982)
posts.title: Alpha Kappa Omega Batch ’81
posts.excerpt: Quote: Sid Lucero, a 26-year old pre-Med student is an aspiring neophyte of the Alpha Kappa Omega fraternity. Over a six-month initiation period, he and six other neophytes are subjected to severe physical and psychological torture in and outside the fraternity house. The neophytes come to accept the senseless violence as a requisite of their …

posts.title: Fuocoammare
posts.excerpt: Quote: Even if they were bringing the bodies of dead migrants ashore a few minutes from where you live, you’d still brew up coffee and cook dinner with the radio on. Your kids would still do their homework and get to school in the morning. Life would go on – not necessarily oblivious to the …

posts._title: Ingmar Bergman – Det regnar på vår kärlek AKA It Rains on Our Love (1946)
posts.title: Det regnar på vår kärlek
posts.excerpt: Quote: It Rains on Our Love / Det regnar på vår kärlek (1946) was Bergman’s fourth film and it paints a very romantic picture of poverty and love on the run. Two young lovebirds from the wrong side of the tracks find peace of a kind in an idyllic, rural squatters’ community. It’s like a …

posts._title: James Quinn – Flesh of the Void (2017)
posts.title: Flesh of the Void
posts.excerpt: Flesh of the Void is a terribly disturbing experimental horror film about what it could feel like if death truly were the most horrible thing one could ever experience. It is intended as a trip through the deepest fears of human beings, exploring its subject in a highly grotesque, violent and extreme manner.

posts._title: Richard Compton – Welcome Home, Soldier Boys (1971)
posts.title: Welcome Home, Soldier Boys
posts.excerpt: Plot Synopsis Discharged from a tour of duty in VietNam, a group of soldiers drives across the US to take in the nation they fought for. posts._title: Dusan Makavejev – Nevinost bez zastite aka Innocence Unprotected (1968)
posts.title: Nevinost bez zastite
posts.excerpt: Quote: Innocence Unprotected was originally filmed in 1941 under the title Nevinoz bez Zastite; it was meant to be the first all-talking feature ever made in Serbia. Yugoslav gymnast Dragolijub Aleksic wrote, produced, directed and starred in this simple tale of a young man who rescues his lady love from her wicked stepmother. The film …
